item.title: After 34 Years Someone Finally Beat Tetris - aGameScout
item.description: Link. The evolution of the Tetris Meta is a great example for humanity’s tenacity for continuous improvement. It’s yet another case for how we as a group are able to achieve impossible efforts, through standing on the shoulders of those before us.

item.title: Life Advice From Bjarne Stroustrup
item.description: Be flexible, patient and have a balanced life. Careers and life are long-term objectives, and they stand to benefit from those with balanced, human-centered perspectives.

item.title: "Dreams without goals are just dreams, and ultimately, they fuel disappointment"
item.description: YouTube Link. Dreams without goals are just dreams, and ultimately, they fuel disappointment. On the road to achieving your dreams, you must apply discipline, but more importantly consistency.

item.title: "Focusing Your Unconscious Mind: Learn Hard Concepts Intuitively (And Forever)" - Colin Galen
item.description: YouTube video by Colin Galen TL;DR: Guide the learning process by trying to “invent” the concepts you are learning, with genuine interest.

item.title: A Case For Analogue Journaling And Tools
item.description: Happy new year! With the turn of the new year, my thoughts turned to some mental/lifestyle housekeeping, and I made some changes I’d like to share.

item.title: Achieving AWS SA - Associate (SAA-C03) Certification
item.description: View my badge! Certified: 11th Aug 2023. Thoughts on Content: Generally, all cloud service offerings are based on familiar, existing technologies that customers would normally have hosted themselves on-premises.

item.title: After Dark - Murakami
item.description: After Dark - Murakami Notes: Highlights Page: 14 11:57 ^ref-2825 Page: 14 P.M. ^ref-21818 Page: 18 “Uh�mind?” ^ref-32376

item.title: Bash Basic Syntax
item.description: Learning Resources: Skimming and pulling creating notes for TILs: Bash Scripting Tutorial for Beginners (FreeCodeCamp Video) Google Style Guide https://linuxcommand.

item.title: Bash Programming
item.description: Refreshing my knowledge, and building my own boilerplate cheatsheets: Index: [[Digital-Cottage/Notes/Bash Basic Syntax Refresher|Bash Basic Syntax Refresher]] [[Digital-Cottage/Notes/bash-sed|bash-sed]] [[Digital-Cottage/Notes/bash-awk|bash-awk]] [[Digital-Cottage/Notes/bash-find]] [[Digital-Cottage/Notes/bash-grep|bash-grep]] [[Digital-Cottage/Notes/bash-find|bash-find]] [[Digital-Cottage/Notes/bash-read|bash-read]]

item.title: bash-awk
item.description: Resources: GeeksforGeeks - awk Usecase: awk is a scripting language that allows text manipulation, but also arithmetic and conditional logic.

item.title: bash-find
item.description: Resources: GeeksforGeeks Syntax: 1 2 3 4 5 6 find [where to start searching from] [expression determines what to find] [-options] [what to find] e.

item.title: bash-sed
item.description: Resources: GeeksforGeeks - sed Usecase: sed stands for “stream editor”. It can perform text search and replace, insertion and deletion.

item.title: Books
item.description: Quotes, summaries and reviews of books I’ve read. Format is {Title:Author} [[Digital-Cottage/Books/After Dark - Murakami|After Dark - Murakami]] [[Digital-Cottage/Books/Flow - Csikszentmihalyi|Flow - Csikszentmihalyi]] [[Digital-Cottage/Books/Four Thousand Weeks - Burkeman|Four Thousand Weeks - Burkeman]] [[Digital-Cottage/Books/The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People - Covey|The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People - Covey]] [[Digital-Cottage/Books/The Defining Decade - Jay|The Defining Decade - Jay]] [[Digital-Cottage/Books/The Psychology of Money - Housel|The Psychology of Money - Housel]]

item.title: BTS Anime Production - Studio Trigger (LWA)
Christopher Nolan's Oppenheimer
item.description: Super inspiring to be reminded of the incredibly impressive figures that spurred the scientific revolution of the 20th century. Reminded me of my fascination as a younger child, with inventors and their creations made through the magic of science and logic.

item.title: Clean Code
item.description: Resource: link

item.title: Coding without expectations vs. intentional intensity
item.description: In my learning journey, I’m noticing there’s two schools of thought to approaching the prerequisite “10,000 hours of mastery”. Callous your mind and work with intensity, and predetermined targets This approach focuses primarily on one’s tenacity and effort.

item.title: Daily Journal Template 2024
item.description: Daily Journal - {{date: dddd, DD MMM YYYY}} [!quote] I created a mission statement here after reading [[Digital-Cottage/Books/The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People - Covey|The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People - Covey]].

item.title: Edsger Dijkstra’s One-Day Workweek
item.description: Link Dijkstra only went into university once a week to discuss ideas, and yet was able to produce high volume of academic reports during the tenure.

item.title: Fitness Dashboard
item.description: Link to repo. Concept: My friends and I are big fans of a simple gym-tracking app that serves to replace a simple notebook and pen, called “FitNotes”.

item.title: Flow - Csikszentmihalyi
item.description: Flow - Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi Notes: Highlights Page: 29 If something feels good, if it is natural and spontaneous, then it must be right.

item.title: Four Thousand Weeks - Burkeman
item.description: Four Thousand Weeks - Oliver Burkeman Notes: Productivity is a trap. It provides a false narrative that doing things quicker, and thus more of it, results in better results.

item.title: Go all the way
item.description: If you’re going to try, go all the way. Otherwise, don’t even start. This could mean losing girlfriends, wives, relatives and maybe even your mind.

item.title: HiddenBrain - Strategies Against Ruts And Stuckness
item.description: Spotify Link Podcast Notes: The goal gradient: As the goal becomes into sight, the experience in working towards something begins to exhibit a “downhill” motivational effect.

item.title: How To Get Started - The Cult of Done
item.description: Introduced to the concept by No Boilerplate, who frames it with his own perspective and presents it very well ( link).

item.title: Inspiration Vault
item.description: Inspiring figures: [[Digital-Cottage/Notes/Robert J. Oppenheimer|Robert J. Oppenheimer]] [[Digital-Cottage/Notes/Socrates|Socrates]]

item.title: Jony Ivy - The Man behind Apple Design
item.description: YouTube Link Steve Jobs and John allowed design teams to butt heads and have more of a leading role in product design, which required engineering teams to accommodate and compromise, for design goals.

item.title: Making a Portable Mac Mini - Scott Yu-Jan
item.description: 3D printing seems like a low barrier to entry way to start experimenting with physical craftmanship. Super cool. He identifies himself as a [[Digital-Cottage/Resonance Journal/Maker|Maker]] – interesting to see the creative passion shown in ways beyond software which I’m used to.

item.title: Notes
item.description: Free-for-all space for sharing notes I’ve created within my digital Personal Knowledge Management systems. [[Digital-Cottage/Notes/Achieving AWS SA - Associate (SAA-C03) Certification|Achieving AWS SA - Associate (SAA-C03) Certification]]

item.title: Personally Defined Rules For Learning With AI
item.description: Fundamentally, AI should be used as a first-point substitution for scanning of documentation, rubber ducky-ing as well as a tool to reduce start-up friction to tasks — but rarely as a tool for bridging gaps in logic ability.

item.title: pipenv
item.description: Installation 1 2 sudo apt-get remove python3-pipenv sudo pip3 install pipenv (or sudo pip install pipenv) Commands 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 # To run/create pipfile sudo pipenv install # enter environment: pipenv shell # exit: deactivate Resources https://askubuntu.

item.description: YouTube Link Similar anecdote video Takeaways: Connect with the satisfaction that comes from coding, as the same satisfaction provided with gaming.

item.title: Robert J. Oppenheimer
item.description: A brilliant and highly influential physicist who held a cross-sectional view on life. He was esteemed within the scientific community for his achievements in theoretical physics, but is most-well known for orchestrating a mammoth directive effort to achieve the creation of the first atomic bomb in history.

item.title: Setting Up An Obsidian-based Digital Garden Website
item.description: It’s been a backlog priority of mine for a while now to start writing online. As someone who has been working with a second brain/PKM system for a while now (Notion & Obsidian), I figured a solution that can leverage that personal written content for the purpose would be ideal:

item.title: Setting up AWS sub-account structure for projects
item.description: [!note] AWS is shifting towards a system of IAM Identity Center (previously AWS SSO) federation and permission sets as recommended best practice, for setting up console/access keys.

item.title: Setting up Flask Web App serving from EC2 Instance
item.description: [!note] Will pull notes from [[Digital-Cottage/Notes/Private/Fitness Dashboard Dev v2|Fitness Dashboard Dev v2|Private/Fitness Dashboard Dev v2|Fitness Dashboard Dev v2]] to populate this.

item.title: Setting up SSH to EC2 Instances
item.description: For existing/running instances: Navigate to “Key Pairs” in the AWS EC2 console menu. Create Key pair - name it something memorable or it will default to id_rsa.

item.title: Shit rentals and the value of a social media following
item.description: A friend shared an article recently that detailed how “Tiktoker” Jodie van den Berg, had launched a database website that allowed previous renters of “shit rentals” to share their experience for future tenants.

item.title: Socrates
item.description: Death of Socrates: Socrates was brought to trial for impety, despite lack of evidence. This was likely orchestrated by his political rivals.

item.title: Talent is a pursued interest
item.description: Quote: Talent is a pursued interest. Anything that you’re willing to practice, you can do.

item.title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People - Covey
item.description: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People - Stephen R. Covey Notes: Highlights Page: 10 The Character Ethic taught that there are basic principles of effective living, and that people can only experience true success and enduring happiness as they learn and integrate these principles into their basic character.

item.title: The Defining Decade - Jay
item.description: The Defining Decade - Meg Jay Notes: Highlights Page: 38 families become busier and more defined. So—even and especially as we job-hop and move cross-country and change roommates and ^ref-1740

item.title: The Psychology of Money - Housel
item.description: The Psychology of Money - Morgan Housel Notes: Highlights Page: 55 Having a strong sense of controlling one’s life is a more dependable predictor of positive feelings of wellbeing than any of the objective conditions of life we have considered.

item.title: We are what we repeatedly do.
item.description: Quote: “We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act but a habit.”

item.title: Why Socrates Hated Democracy
item.description: YouTube Link. The Ship of State analogy, which argues the unreasonable nature of choosing a likeable, but unqualified individual to captain a ship responsible for dozens of other lives.
